Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 1: Administration of Medications

Implementing Assessment For Learning

There are many ways to assess for learning: in other words, there are many methods of using assessments formatively. There are also many ways to leverage the power of tech tools in the process. Open each accordion to review our recommendations for implementing assessment for learning in your classroom.  Spend 10-15 minutes exploring the resources linked in the accordions. Select the arrow to read more about different assessments for learning recommendations.

  • Exit Ticket

    In this type of assessment, students are asked to solve a problem or answer a question as they leave the classroom or close out that ‘subject’ for the day. This provides teachers with a quick check to assess student progress and inform any changes that may be necessary for instruction the next day.
    The following example shows how to utilize the Traffic Light Exit Ticket Strategy. Jamboard is another great tool to find Exit Ticket template ideas.

  • The Right Medication

    Check the name of the medicine on the form and the name of the medicine on the label of the bottle to be sure they are the same.

  • The Right Dose

    Compare the dose on the label with the amount you have prepared in the application device. Be sure to pay particular attention to whether the medication dose is listed in milliliters (ml) or milligrams(mg) and note which is identified on the administering tool. Sometimes a conversion is required on your part.

  • The Right Way

    Check the label to be sure you are giving the medication the same route that it is ordered.

  • The Right Time

    Check the form and medication label to ensure you are giving the medication at the proper time.
